incident_updates.body:
On `2025-05-13` We experienced an outage affecting the Bitly Public API from `18:12Z` to `18:34Z`. This affected the ability to use the Bitly site or create new links, but did not impact usage of any existing links.

The root cause was an error with a newly provisioned application secret which caused a fatal API service error that didn't fail our deployment pipeline.

Our monitoring systems detected the issue quickly and we successfully rolled back to restore services. We have since taken steps towards resolving root causes, including improving secrets validation and faster failure detection during service initialization.
This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and we are working to restore the service.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating reports of a major service outage impacting our public API. Our on-call team is working to identify and resolve this issue. We will provide an update within 30 minutes.

From `16:41Z` - `23:56Z`  operations on and access to user uploaded images failed. This affected user ability to add new images to QR codes and Pages, and affected display of user uploaded images on Page buttons and backgrounds.

The root cause was human error by our service provider during the application of a policy change. A restriction intended for one object incorrectly applied at the bucket level.

We understand the significant impact this has had and we are taking steps with our service provider to prevent this from happening again.
The issue has been resolved, and all services appear to be operating as expected.
We are seeing improvement and will continue to monitor the situation.
We have identified the issue and are working to resolve it. Images are unable to be retrieved or uploaded. This may affect QR Code logos and Bitly Pages with images.
We are continuing to investigate, this is also affecting uploading images.
We are currently investigating an issue preventing uploaded images to be fetched. This could be affecting Link in Bios and QR codes.

incidents.name: Issues Processing PayPal Payment Method at Checkout

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Our 3rd party provider has implemented a fix for the service disruption that was causing issues with using PayPal as a payment method in our checkout flow. We have observed recovery and will continue to monitor the situation. PayPal payment methods should now be function in our checkout flow, but if you continue to encounter any issues, using credit card is still a viable workaround.

We are currently experiencing issues processing PayPal as a payment method in our online checkout flow. If you need to make a purchase, you can still do so successfully by providing a credit card as your payment method instead. The provider has acknowledged the service disruption and the cause is currently under investigation. We are monitoring the situation closely and will share an update as soon as we know more!

This incident has been resolved.
We're investigate an elevated API error rate. Thanks for your patience!

On `2024-09-16` We experienced an outage affecting the Bitly Pages product from `19:03Z` to `21:11Z`. The root cause was an added dependency which impacted client-side rendering of Pages. This issue was not immediately detected by automated tests or monitors.

From `20:27Z` to `21:11Z`, our oncall team activated a recovery system allowing Pages served on the `bit.ly` domain to recover. Some custom domains continued to see impact. The code change contributing to the outage was identified and rolled back allowing for full recovery of Page rendering.

We have already taken steps in our automation to detect similar rendering problems before they can affect our customers. We apologize for the inconvenience this outage may have caused and understand the impact to our customers. We place a high value on the reliability of our services and are evaluating ways to improve our ability to mitigate this type of issue. We also understand the impact and potential confusion caused by the lack of messaging during this outage. We value highly and will work to improve our ability to communicate about incidents in a timely fashion.
The validation of the fix has completed. Bitly Pages are fully operational again.
A fix has been identified and we are monitoring the results.
Hi community. We are aware of a service outage specifically impacting our Link In Bio product and are currently investigating a fix.

incidents.name: Major Service Outage - Website, API and Pages

incident_updates.body: On `2024-08-14` We experienced an outage affecting the Bitly API from `15:03Z` to `15:10Z` and affecting the Bitly website from `15:03Z` to `15:31Z`. The root cause was a failure in our deployment pipeline which caused the incorrect release to be deployed. This change was immediately detected and rolled back but the failure triggered an unknown dependency loop which required a manual rollback to restore some systems. We have already taken steps to resolve some root causes and are evaluating ways to improve our ability to rollback more quickly in similar situations.
This incident has been resolved.
We have implemented a fix for the issue that was affecting our Website, API, and Pages and we are seeing full recovery. We will continue monitoring and report back with any updates.

incidents.name: Issues with the Bitly web application

incident_updates.body: From `17:35Z` through `18:21Z` on `2023-12-20` Bitly experienced a major outage affecting Website, API and Link In Bio functionality. The root cause was a change to internal service load balancing health checks which prevented services from being updated during a deployment. Link redirects remained functional during the incident. Webhooks were delayed during the incident.
This incident has been resolved.
Good news, community: if you were impacted by the earlier issue, you should now be able to access our services without any problems. Thanks for bearing with us!
Update: Things are looking up, but we still have work to do. Thanks so much for your patience!

incidents.name: Partial Service Disruption -- Redirects, bitly.com & Link-in-Bio

incident_updates.body:
On `2023-10-28` we experienced a DDoS attack against our platform. Our oncall team responded promptly and worked to mitigate impacts to our services. From `04:56 UTC` to `06:26 UTC` we experienced intermittent but significant impact to the Bitly website, Link-in-Bio pages, and redirects for custom domains with DNS A records. Some custom domains continued to see impact until `19:51 UTC` when we released additional updates to our mitigation strategy. The Bitly API and links on the bit.ly domain and custom domains with DNS CNAME records continued to work throughout this period.

Additionally, during this incident our status page provider was conducting a maintenance window and experienced an outage of its own which affected our ability to communicate our investigation and response to this incident via status.bitly.com in a timely manner. At `05:55 UTC` we were able to update bitly.com with some details of our incident response.

We apologize for the inconvenience this outage may have caused and understand the impact to our customers. We place a high value on the reliability of our services and are evaluating ways to improve our ability to mitigate this type of issue. We also understand the impact and potential confusion caused by the lack of messaging during this outage. We value highly and will work to improve our ability to communicate about incidents in a timely fashion.

An incident between 2023-10-28 04:26:00 UTC and 2023-10-28 06:36:00 UTC caused intermittent issues with redirects and bitly.com as well as a full outage of Link-in-Bio.

The incident has been resolved.

At `16:10 UTC` on April 25th Bitly's backup system protecting click and scan functionality automatically engaged and our on-call Engineering team was alerted to errors within our website and API including impact to the ability to create new links.  
By `16:28 UTC` we had identified the root cause as an issue affecting internal load balancing with our cloud hosting service provider \(details on this incident can be found on their [status page](https://status.cloud.google.com/incidents/gsr6HAk6oCUpNG4CAZ1H)\).  
  
Our Engineering team worked directly with the service provider and took necesary steps to restore service once the service provider mitigated the incident. Once the cloud load balancers were back online, access to our website and public API was quickly restored; by `17:31 UTC` our production systems were fully functional.  
  
We sincerely apologize to our customers who were impacted during this disruption.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
This issue has been identified as a service outage with our Hosting Provider. Mitigation work is underway.
